name: Dinner Tonight: Apple, Beetroot, and Cheddar Salad
description: I've staked my claim before against overly-fancified salads, full of fruit and nuts and other frivolity. How many endive, blue cheese, and candied walnut recipes can one world eat? Give me a bowl of good farmers' market greens and nothing...
recipeIngredient: 1 small, raw beet, about the same size as the apple
3 1/2 ounces mature, crumbly cheddar, thinly sliced
A pinch each of salt and sugar

recipeInstructions.text: In the bottom of a large salad bowl, combine the vinegar, salt, and freshly cracked black pepper. Add the olive or hempseed oil in a slow stream, whisking constantly, to create an emulsion. Continue adding the rest of the oil in the same manner.

In a medium skillet, toast the hazelnuts over medium-high heat. If they are unskinned, toast until the skins crack then gather in a kitchen towel and roughly rub them together. The skins should slip away easily. Return to the skillet to toast.

Halve, core, and thinly slice the apple. Peel, trim, and thinly slice the beet. Add the salad greens to the bowl and toss, then add the apple and beetslices and the nuts. Crumble the cheddar slices over the top and finish with black pepper.
